ea4cd2f0efef9310f548e4f684415402 (20:04): jshint code is a doozy
ea4cd2f0efef9310f548e4f684415402 (20:05): crockford has some nerve talking about code readability!
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (20:05): ea4cd2f0efef9310f548e4f684415402, it is not so bad :-)
ea4cd2f0efef9310f548e4f684415402 (20:06): haha, what do you think of this? https://github.com/jshint/jshint/issues#issue/56
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (20:06): actually, he rewrote the code using top-down tree technique and it is much better
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (20:06): but we can't use it because he hardcoded stupid rules like "moving vars to the top" and it is pain in the ass make them optional
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (20:07): what does (args.push(commit), args) accomplish? looks like python tuple but js does not have tuples? does it work in all browsers?
ea4cd2f0efef9310f548e4f684415402 (20:07): yeah, the comma operater evaluates the left and return the right
ea4cd2f0efef9310f548e4f684415402 (20:08): so i push on the left and return the actual modified array on the right
f77136d30ffa1db0c8ac0bb00e28b29c (20:10): wow. I didn't know about the comma operator
f77136d30ffa1db0c8ac0bb00e28b29c (20:10): searches for code to refactor

eb3f49ff0e7508a6bd7e68a4f9ef04d4 (21:48): can the data tag be used today? or is it not fully compatible with browsers at the moment?
eb3f49ff0e7508a6bd7e68a4f9ef04d4 (21:48): im currently using the rel attribute to hold data
f77136d30ffa1db0c8ac0bb00e28b29c (21:49): and look at jQuery's data methods
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (21:49): elm.dataList not so much, but .getAttribute() works fine
eb3f49ff0e7508a6bd7e68a4f9ef04d4 (21:49): is it fully supported? most of our audience use older browsers and ie
eb3f49ff0e7508a6bd7e68a4f9ef04d4 (21:49): i already know about jquery's data methods, which was the reason i came here before using it
f77136d30ffa1db0c8ac0bb00e28b29c (21:49): data-* is just an attribute right now nothing fancy.
f77136d30ffa1db0c8ac0bb00e28b29c (21:50): which is why getAttribute will work if you don't use jQuery or  similar
eb3f49ff0e7508a6bd7e68a4f9ef04d4 (21:50): i suppose as long as jquery see's it, it doesnt matter about the browser?
f77136d30ffa1db0c8ac0bb00e28b29c (21:52): pretty much the browser doesn't care. Just don't go putting quotation marks or equal signs or other weird characters  in your data-attribute names. :-)
f77136d30ffa1db0c8ac0bb00e28b29c (22:26): Is there anyway to prevent the browser from scrolling when the hash is changed to an the id of an element in the document?
f77136d30ffa1db0c8ac0bb00e28b29c (22:28): some context to my last question: <a href="#section">Link</a><div id="section">Hello</div>

f77136d30ffa1db0c8ac0bb00e28b29c (22:29): If the page that HTML is scrollable the browser with jump to that section when the link is clicked, even if the element is already visible in the viewport. which sucks.
